SENT.plain: INTRODUCTION: Severe pulmonary tuberculosis may be complicated by deep vein thrombosis due to a state of hypercoagulability
OBSERVATION: We report a case of pulmonary miliary tuberculosis associated with cerebral venous thrombosis and multiple intracranial tuberculomas
A 65-year-old woman developed a confusional syndrome one week after starting treatment for pulmonary military tuberculosis
Neuroimaging reveals a thrombus in the right lateral sinus and multiple silent intracranial tuberculoma
CONCLUSION: The patient was given anticoagulants and fully recovered
